name: Simon Laplace (Simon)
appearance: A lean Caucasian man with a weary expression and unkempt hair. His clothing is often mismatched and worn from constant travel, giving him the look of someone who rarely stays in one place for long.
personality: Protective, guilt-ridden, and restless. Simon shows a surprising sense of conscience despite his morally gray past. Distrustful of authority, but deeply loyal to the few people he cares about.
background: Simon Laplace is a hacker with dissociative identity disorder (dual personality). His alter ego is Anatole. Simon is a skilled hacker who has been in a long-running online rivalry with Lucifero (Jenny Florence), though they never met in person. During the 2003 Reindeer Bar incident, Anatole was in control of the body and had an argument with Lucifero. Simon was one of the suspects in the murder case. He lives in Cassandra with Nancy Charlotte, running a flower shop. He discovered Patrizio's secrets by hacking into his computer over a year ago, downloading a mysterious image. He wants to stop Patrizio's cult activities but fears for his life if his identity as a hacker is revealed.
goals: Protect Nancy and help her rebuild her life
Stop Patrizio's cult activities and prevent disaster in Cassandra
Keep his identity as a hacker secret to avoid being killed
Help investigators solve the murder cases and expose the truth

properties.note: Located in his workshop on the second floor of the flower shop. Used for hacking and monitoring networks.

properties.clue: An image downloaded from Patrizio's computer over a year ago, revealing Patrizio's cult activities. Viewing it requires an INT check and may cause SAN loss (1/1d4).

relationships.description: Acts as her protector and caretaker.
relationships.history: Rescued her from exploitation and chose a drifting life to keep her safe.

relationships.description: Anatole disapproves of Simon’s choices and lifestyle.

notes: Simon may be reluctant to share information unless investigators convince him they pose no threat to Nancy.
